intro: Combesia muscosa var. acuminata, commonly known as the slender combesia, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Araceae, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, exhibiting a rhizomatous growth habit. Its leaves are elongated and often have a waxy surface, while the flowers are small and clustered around the spadix. This variant is distinguished by its acuminate (sharply pointed) leaf tips, contributing to its unique botanical appearance.
